# alicloud\_amqp\_instances

This data source provides the Amqp Instances of the current Alibaba Cloud user.

-> **NOTE:** Available in v1.128.0+.

## Example Usage

Basic Usage

```typescript
import * as constructs from "constructs";
import * as cdktf from "cdktf";
/*Provider bindings are generated by running cdktf get.
See https://cdk.tf/provider-generation for more details.*/
import * as alicloud from "./.gen/providers/alicloud";
class MyConvertedCode extends cdktf.TerraformStack {
  constructor(scope: constructs.Construct, name: string) {
    super(scope, name);
    const dataAlicloudAmqpInstancesIds =
      new alicloud.dataAlicloudAmqpInstances.DataAlicloudAmqpInstances(
        this,
        "ids",
        {
          ids: ["amqp-abc12345", "amqp-abc34567"],
        }
      );
    const dataAlicloudAmqpInstancesNameRegex =
      new alicloud.dataAlicloudAmqpInstances.DataAlicloudAmqpInstances(
        this,
        "nameRegex",
        {
          nameRegex: "^my-Instance",
        }
      );
    new cdktf.TerraformOutput(this, "amqp_instance_id_1", {
      value: cdktf.propertyAccess(dataAlicloudAmqpInstancesIds.instances, [
        "0",
        "id",
      ]),
    });
    new cdktf.TerraformOutput(this, "amqp_instance_id_2", {
      value: cdktf.propertyAccess(
        dataAlicloudAmqpInstancesNameRegex.instances,
        ["0", "id"]
      ),
    });
  }
}

```

## Argument Reference

The following arguments are supported:

* `enableDetails` - (Optional) Default to `false`. Set it to `true` can output more details about resource attributes.
* `ids` - (Optional, ForceNew, Computed)  A list of Instance IDs.
* `nameRegex` - (Optional, ForceNew) A regex string to filter results by Instance name.
* `outputFile` - (Optional) File name where to save data source results (after running `terraform plan`).
* `status` - (Optional, ForceNew) The status of the resource. Valid values: "DEPLOYING", "EXPIRED", "RELEASED", "SERVING".

## Argument Reference

The following attributes are exported in addition to the arguments listed above:

* `names` - A list of Instance names.
* `instances` - A list of Amqp Instances. Each element contains the following attributes:
	* `createTime` - OrderCreateTime.
	* `expireTime` - ExpireTime.
	* `id` - The ID of the Instance.
	* `instanceId` - THe instance Id.
	* `instanceName` - THe instance name.
	* `instanceType` - The instance type.
	* `paymentType` - The Pay-as-You-Type Values Include: the Subscription of a Pre-Paid.
	* `privateEndPoint` - The private endPoint.
	* `publicEndpoint` - The public dndpoint.
	* `renewalDuration` - Renewal duration.
	* `renewalDurationUnit` - Auto-Renewal Cycle Unit Values Include: Month: Month. Year: Years.
	* `renewalStatus` - Renew status.
	* `status` - The status of the resource.
	* `supportEip` - Whether to support eip.
